intro: Minuartia pestalozzae, commonly known as the Pestalozza's rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are linear and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Minuartia pestalozzae is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in alpine or arctic regions.
